body:
I've set up an integrated daylighting and building energy model for a number of shading geometries. I was originally running all the calculations through OpenStudio but I was getting unrealistically low transmitted beam energy values. I went to double check these results by plugging in the same HBZones into EnergyPlus and got much more realistic results. 

I've spend a lot of time adjusting inputs to see if something was throwing off OpenStudio. I use a lot of custom schedules but none should affect transmitted solar energy. I've even tried with no shading devices and still get drastically different results. 

I have attached my file if that is helpful for debugging. Am I doing something wrong to throw off the results?
topic: EnergyPlus and OpenStudio Components Giving Different Transmitted Solar Energy

replies.body:
Hi Justin,

This sounds like a bug! Thanks for reporting. Have you checked the idf files to see if Honeybee OpenStudio exports Windows materials correctly?

I'll be quite busy until later this week but added this to [github](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/503) so I or one of the other developers check this ASAP.

Thank you so much for reporting!

Mostapha
